section.title: Name
section.para: FvwmTabs is a generic tabbing module for the FVWM window manager.

section.title: Synopsis
section.para: FvwmTabs is spawned by FVWM, so no command line invocation is possible.

section.title: Description
section.para: The FvwmTabs module is capable of swallowing any FVWM window & treating it as a tab in a tab-manager window. A tab-manager is sometimes called a tabber. Each tab-manager can store any number of windows, each in its own tab. The number of tab-managers is limited only by system resources. Tab-managers can even be nested/swallowed within other tab-managers. (ie. a tab-manager can be added as an individual tab to another tab-manager.)

section.title: Invocation
section.para: FvwmTabs can be invoked by inserting the line:
in your .fvwmrc file. This can be placed on a line by itself, if FvwmTabs is to be spawned during FVWM's initialization, or can be bound to a menu, mouse button or keystroke to invoke it later.

section.title: Installing Dependencies
section.para: FvwmTabs requires 2 CPAN modules (that are NOT distributed with FVWM) to be installed on your system. They are Tk and X11::Protocol.
section.programlisting: tar zxvf $name.tar.gz ; cd $name ; perl Makefile.PL ; make install
section.para: FvwmTabs will tell you if you do not have these packages installed when you (try to) start it.
